results.title: Co-operative learning: from 'me' to 'we'
results.creator_credit: Rob McCubbin and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: Presents a classroom view of cooperative learning highlighting the key aspects of successful implementation. It is based on the experiences of four teachers showing cooperative learning at different stages of use in their classrooms.

results.title: Physicists for industry
results.creator_credit: John Garrity, Trafford Price and Royal Melbourne Institute of Technology
results.brief_description: Promotes the various course of options in Applied Physics for prospective students. It emphasizes the practical project work involved and the fields of industry open to graduates. Such as the interior design for the acoustics at the Melbourne Concert Hall etc.

results.title: Food additives
results.creator_credit: Shane Mulcahy, Deborah Manners, Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education and Open Tafe
results.brief_description: A discussion with Dr. K. Farrer, author of “Fancy eating that” who describes the history of food additives and examines what is added and why. He also addresses the safety aspects of additives and regulations to control their use. Hosted by Peter Couchman.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Shane Mulcahy, Deborah Manners, Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education and Open Tafe

results.title: Computing History: Teaching With a New Technology
results.creator_credit: David Tiley, Penny Robins, Commonwealth Schools Commission (Australia) and Video Projects

video_links.name: Computing History: Teaching With a New Technology

results.brief_description: Looks at the use of computers as word-processors and databases in the teaching of history. Programs such as database, newsroom and open database are shown being used. The program also highlights some of the problems, and some of the advantages of using this approach to the teaching of history.

results.title: Past times
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Trevor Lunn and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Presented by Rob Gell, this video looks at Australia’s pre-history with reference to creatures living during the Proterozoic and Phanerozoic eons. One of a series produced in conjunction with Youth/ANZAAS.

results.title: Open Learning
results.creator_credit: Trish Pilley and Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education
results.brief_description: The open learning (or Open TAFE) concept means basing the course on a learning need of the particular student rather than needs of the institution. It allows students to study off-campus and in their own time. The differences between ‘open’ and ‘closed’ (or traditional learning) are mentioned. Introduced and narrated by Peter Couchman
results.creator_credit_for_label: Trish Pilley and Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education
results.description: The open learning (or Open TAFE) concept means basing the course on a learning need of the particular student rather than needs of the institution. results.title: Human rights video kit. Parts 1 & 2
results.creator_credit: Keith Saggers and Education Department of Western Australia
results.brief_description: Highlights the problems associated with the protection of basic human rights as experienced trough the work of Ammesty International and similar organizations. Part 1 Dramatizes what it would be like to be an adolescent whose human rights were completely removed. Part 2 Provides a case history of a person detained without reason for helping student dissenters.
